channel.title: attack.t1482 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1482 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious Execution of SharpView Aka PowerView
item.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

item.title: AzureHound PowerShell Commands
item.description: Detects the execution of AzureHound in PowerShell, a tool to gather data from Azure for BloodHound

item.title: Correct Execution of Nltest.exe
item.description: The attacker might use LOLBAS nltest.exe for discovery of domain controllers, domain trusts, parent domain and the current user permissions.

item.title: Suspicious AdFind Execution
item.description: Detects the execution of a AdFind for Active Directory enumeration

item.title: Trickbot Malware Recon Activity
item.description: Trickbot enumerates domain/network topology and executes certain commands automatically every few minutes. This detectors attempts to identify that activity based off a command rarely observed in an enterprise network.

item.title: Bloodhound and Sharphound Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: AdFind Usage Detection
item.description: AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.

item.title: LDAP Reconnaissance / Active Directory Enumeration
item.description: Detects possible Active Directory enumeration via LDAP

item.title: Recon Activity with NLTEST
item.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery
